message.content: This question requires an understanding of the different types of sensory experiences. The sensation of feeling is associated with touch. Option (B), clothes on the thighs, refers to the tactile sensation of clothing against the skin. Option (A) refers to the visual sensation of the sun on the leaves, option (C) refers to the auditory sensation of water running in a river, and option (D) refers to the visual and auditory sensation of air blowing trees around.

This question requires understanding of the different types of sensory experiences. Option (B) is the correct answer because it describes the sensation of feeling clothes on the thighs, which is a tactile sensation. Option (A) describes the sensation of warmth from the sun on leaves, which is a form of touch, but it is not specifically related to feeling. Option (C) describes the sound of water running, which is a auditory sensation, not a feeling. Option (D) describes the movement of air, which is also not related to the sense of feeling.

This question tests understanding of the concept of "feeling" in terms of sensory experiences. Option (A) is incorrect because feeling refers to touch, not the sun on leaves. Option (C) is incorrect because feeling does not refer to auditory sensations like the sound of water running. Option (D) is incorrect because feeling does not refer to the visual sensation of seeing trees blowing in the wind.
